sub_title: Senior Scientific Editor at Cell Press
summary: Professionally valued interdisciplinary editor with analytical prowess and strategic planning in my repertoire. I've gained skills in problem-solving, customer-relationship management, negotiation, and leading partnership to thrive through challenges while meeting project deadlines in dynamic cross-functional teams. I am also a trained musician and play Sitar, Mandolin, and Guitar.

treasury_media.title: Cell Press: iScience
treasury_media.description: iScience is a new open-access journal from Cell Press that provides a platform for original research in the life, physical, and earth sciences. The primary criterion for publication in iScience is a significant contribution to a relevant field combined with robust results and underlying methodology.

authors.headline: Senior Scientific Editor at Cell Press

profile_positions.description:
- Subject expert in Neuroscience, Imaging tool development, Structural biology, and Biophysics.
- Consulting editor with 5 CP journals, CP Community Review, and RIAX.
- Manage & devise strategies for the article transfers, establish new relationships, and collaborate across CP to develop feedback mechanisms to improve transfer uptakes. 
- Managing a team of 22 Guest Editors (GEs), Academic Editors, and Editorial Board Members (EBMs); supporting them in achieving their contractual objectives.
- Experienced with cross-journal content acquisition strategies, especially focusing on China Acceleration Strategy and InD Initiatives.
profile_positions.title: Senior Scientific Editor

profile_positions.description:
- Spearheaded 10+ iScience and cross-journal Special Issues (SIs)/collections
- Facilitated 150+ successful transfers to iScience and handled 3rd highest volume of transferred articles within CP in 2022.
-Supervised & mentored editorial interns and internal editors, ensuring they met their agreed objectives and felt confident in taking leads on discrete iScience projects quickly.
- Devised strategies for competitor analysis, EBM engagements, and research funding to support the journal’s subject area growth in light of the increase in impact factor.
- Developed content acquisition & marketing workflow in response to the journal’s increasing publication volume.
profile_positions.title: Scientific Editor

profile_positions.description:
- Managed peer review of ~10 % of the total iScience content across life and physical sciences.
- Commissioned & recruited primary research, reviews, and front matter articles.
- Built strategic network via launching SIs and by presenting about iScience among the Structural biology and Neuroscience community during conferences and site visits.
- Directed and managed programs for content marketing & outreach via social media and press releases.
- Created CP-wide collections & organized multiple webinars, and generated 20+ leads for iScience SIs post-event.
profile_positions.title: Associate Scientific Editor

profile_positions.description:
•	Redefined editorial scope and bar, ensuring that 70% of strong papers were sent for review during the journal's internal migration.
•	Implemented and managed the Reviewer Selection Editors (RSE) workflow, for streamlining the reviewer selection process for around 100+ manuscripts with an average of 1.3 days turnaround time.
•	Managing a team of 4 internal editors from CP and broader STMJ, Elsevier.
•	Managed peer review of ~8 % of the total content, decision-making, and dealing with conflicts.
profile_positions.title: Interim Editor Neuroimage and Neuroimage Reports

profile_positions.description:
About: It is a platform for enthusiastic writers & editors, inclined to public outreach & creating strong STE(A)M community. It originated from a Career Support Group (a US non-profit 501(3) organization). 

- Advisory & mentor to the editors.
- Content development for quality publications.
- Strategic planning to develop Club SciWri portfolio.
- Establishing collaborations to sustain & increase viewership beyond the existing 140 countries. 
- Developing productive relationships with the editors, editorial board members & public.
profile_positions.title: Publishing Advisor

profile_positions.description:
- Developed editorial program with regulatory oversight for timely publications and R&D activities for new content.
- Lead 10+ collaborations with The BreakoutLabs, The Nanotag Biotechnologies, The Wire, Ipsa Wonders, Fuzzy Synapse and The Science Times.
- Directed programs for marketing, branding & fundraising via social media.
- Managed a global team of 14 editors and illustrators.
- Reached 66,000+ viewership and unique visitors in 140 countries.
- Co-founded & lead the STEMPeers Weekly Digest for the organization's PhD Career Support Group'.
profile_positions.title: Editor In Chief

profile_positions.description:
- Editing & processing of more than 20+ articles.
- Conducting interviews with professionals in academic & a non-academic trajectory, with further insights into the essential skills required for leveraging one's own STEM careers.
- Partnered with artists & writers.
profile_positions.title: Handling Editor and Reporter

profile_positions.description:
- Trained & mentored 4 master’s thesis students.
- Instructors for bi-annual method course on electron microscopy at Göttingen Graduate School for Neurosciences, Biophysics, and Molecular Biosciences (GGNB).
- Co-Instructor for Public Outreach Event: World Under the LEGOScope Nacht der Wissenschaft ("Night of Science"), the University of Göttingen.
profile_positions.title: Supervisor & Mentor

profile_positions.description:
- Established optogenetic stimulation coupled with High-pressure freezing to study the ultrafast neurotransmission at IHC ribbon synapses; crucial for hearing.

- Core expertise in electron microscopy (TEM & TEM tomography), super-resolution microscopy (STED), confocal microscopy & CLEM.

- Developing & managing analysis parameters and tools for large data sets; strong command over bio-statistics.

- Initiated 3 collaborations within Collaborative Research Centre 889.
- Contributed to 2 successful grant proposals: DFG's Collaborative Research Center 889 & DFG' Excellence Cluster Initiative.
- Actively disseminated research results & won accolades at several national and international conferences.

Others
- Founding member of Göttingen Campus Post-Doctoral Community
- Mentee for the competitive Dorothea Schlözer Mentoring program

Career development
- Did online modules of R and Python
- Attended workshops on grant writing
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description:
About: A weekly newsletter to facilitate open-information sharing with a network of 13,000+.

- Co-founded the initiative for the organization 'PhD Career Support Group'.
- Performed content research, writing & design.
- Managed & mentored a team of 12 content editors.
- Within 9 months my team & I, released 40 editions, with a readership of 2,400.
- Achieved an open rate of 15%, i.e., 2% higher than other industrial newsletters.
profile_positions.title: Co-founder & Lead Editor

profile_positions.description:
- I discovered sub-pools of vesicles involved in release at the ribbon synapses.
- Established 3 successful collaborations.
- Actively disseminated research results & won accolades at several national and international conferences

Others
- Student Representative Sensory and Motor Neuroscience Program-GGNB

Career development
- Attended workshops on intercultural communication.
- Co-Instructor for the bi-annual course ‘’Methods of TEM-from tissue preparation to 3D reconstruction.’’
profile_positions.title: PHD Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Project: Investigating the role of Kinesin-2 mutations on synaptic ultrastructure in the ventral ganglion (VG) of Drosophila third instar larvae

- Biological Sample preparation for light & electron microscopy (TEM)
- Ultra-thin microtome sectioning 
- Handling TEM (Zeiss Libra 120)
- Confocal and Fluorescence Microscopy
- Image analysis using Boxer®, ImageJ® and MATLAB®
- Statistical analysis
- Drosophila genetics
profile_positions.title: Junior Research Fellow

volunteer_experiences.description:
o Responsible for the panel on science publishing, communication, & outreach
o Responsible for fund generation

o Under the motto “How to make the most of your postdoc”, we organize bi-annual networking events to bringing together Göttingen campus postdocs from different disciplines 

For more information visit: http://www.goettingen-campus.de/index.php?id=event0

volunteer_experiences.role: Founding Member of Göttingen  Campus Postdoc Community
volunteer_experiences.description:
The Göttingen Campus Postdoc Community is run by and for postdoctoral researchers of the Göttingen Campus.
o Co-organizer for Early Career Researcher Series.
o Facilitating communication among postdoctoral researchers.
o Founding bridge between alumni network, the university career & mentoring services.

For more information visit http://www.goettingen-campus.de/index.php?id=538

volunteer_experiences.role: Student Representative Sensory and Motor Neuroscience Program-GGNB
volunteer_experiences.description:
o The student speaker for the graduate school.
o Advised Ph.D. students from diverse academic background & nationalities through orientation programs.
o A responsible link between the graduate school & students.
o Member of admission panels & involved in the selection of the new Ph.D. candidates.
o Organized the annual retreats in 2014 & 2015, jointly with CRC 889.
o Organized networking meetings between graduate schools & alumni.

volunteer_experiences.role: Public Outreach Coordinator for Bringing MDG to Local Schools
volunteer_experiences.description:
o Generated UN sponsorship for organizing VIT-MUN 2009
o Made teens aware of the working of United Nation & Millennium Development Goals (MDG) 2015.
o Organized interactive workshops for 10 schools in Vellore for 25 days.
